moves.1. d4: So here's an interesting game i played. My first ever tournament game.
moves.1... d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Bd2 Nf6 5: This was a odd move. perhaps the bishop should have gone to e7
moves.7. Bg5 Be7 8. h3 Ne4 9. Bxe7 Qxe7 10. Nx: Here i think black made well to not to exchange queens, because d6 pawn could be dangerous.
moves.17. b4 Qd8 18. c5: I'm now gaining a lot of space, and dangerous past pawns.
moves.18... a5 19. O-O Qd7: i didn't really understand this move.
moves.22. Rdb1 axb4 23. Rxb4 Bc6: Black has been moving the bishop quite a bit here
moves.24. Bb5 Rfb8 25. Bxc6 bxc6 26. Rxb8+ Rxb: Now this pawn is dangerous, obvious move for black is rd8.
moves.29... f5: This was a blunder in my opinion black should have played h3 instead. Because now a surprise is about to appear.
moves.30. a5: 30. a5?! giving up the pawn on d7? There must be something wrong here....
moves.30... Rxd7: black took the bait. now this allows a6.
moves.31. a6: Here black still should have played h3.
moves.32... Kf7 33. Rb7+: And here black resigned. There's nothing he could do to stop my pawn from queening
